description: Single and two storey side to rear extension; single storey rear extension; external alterations (demolition of side extension)
decision_conditions: <p>Insufficient information has been submitted to demonstrate that the proposed development would not result in unacceptable post development pressure on the adjacent street tree located on Sandcroft Road, to the detriment of the health, wellbeing and longevity of the street tree which is considered to be of high amenity value and makes a positive contribution to streetside greenness.&nbsp; The proposed development would therefore be contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy G7 of the London Plan (2021) and policies DM22 and DM23 of the Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).<br></p>

<span style="line-height:normal">The proposed single and two-storey side and rear extension in conjunction with the existing roof extensions on the host property, by reason of its prominent siting, excessive width and poor and awkward design,&nbsp;</span>would give rise to an incongruous, bulky, obtrusive and dominant form of development, resulting in an overdevelopment of the property which would fail to respect the character and appearance of the dwellinghouse and the prevailing pattern of development in the area, to the detriment of the character and appearance of the subject dwellinghouse and the streetscene<span style="line-height:normal">,&nbsp;contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3 D.1 and D.11&nbsp;of the London Plan (2021), core policy CS1 B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2021),&nbsp; Policy DM1 of the Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span><br>
